required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PrizValve® Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement Study
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Efficacy and Safety of the Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement System in Patients With Severe Aortic Valve Stenosis Disease at High Surgical Risk

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical study is to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of the transcatheter aortic valve system in the treatment of patients with severe aortic stenosis who are at high risk of surgery or who are not suitable for surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is an multicenter, single-arm, prospective, safety and performance clinical study.

primary_outcome.description: All-cause mortality within 12 months of TAVI procedure

secondary_outcome.description: All-cause mortality within 2-5 years of TAVI procedure
Rate of Myocardial infarction after TAVI
Rate of All disabling stroke after TAVI
Rate of Severe bleeding after TAVI

intervention.intervention_name: PrizValve® valve and transapical delivery system

facility.name: Department of Cardiology, West China Hospital, Sichuan University
